intro: Pteronia pomonae, commonly known as the apple tree pteronia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in a compact shrub form, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, come in shades of white, pink, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Pteronia pomonae thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, requiring minimal water once established.
